intro: Limnophila chinensis subsp. chevalieri, commonly known as Chinese water fern, is a perennial aquatic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, floating leaves that form a dense mat on the water surface. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in marshes and ponds. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically submerged, followed by the production of buoyant, spore-bearing fruits. Limnophila chinensis subsp. chevalieri plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
